Package ohos.miscservices.timeutility

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.timeutility.Time

  • public class Time
extends Object
    Defines Time objects used for obtaining and setting the system time and time zone.

    This class can be used to obtain the system time, system uptime (including or excluding deep sleep time), thread uptime, and the system time zone.

    Obtain the SystemPermission#SET_TIME permission to set system time. Obtain the SystemPermission#SET_TIME_ZONE permission to set the system time zone.

    Since:
    1

      static long getCurrentTime​()
      Obtains the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the Unix epoch.
      static long getCurrentTimeNs​()
      Obtains the number of nanoseconds that have elapsed since the Unix epoch.
      static long getRealActiveTime​()
      Obtains the number of milliseconds elapsed since the system was booted, not including deep sleep time.

      Obtains the number of nanoseconds elapsed since the system was booted, not including deep sleep time.

      Obtains the number of milliseconds elapsed since the system was booted, including deep sleep time.

      Obtains the number of nanoseconds elapsed since the system was booted, including deep sleep time.

        public static long getCurrentTime​()
        Obtains the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the Unix epoch.
        Returns:
        Returns a positive long integer if obtained; returns a negative number if the time fails to be obtained.

      • setTime

        public static long setTime​(Context context,
                           long time)
        Sets the system time.

        To use this method, obtain the SystemPermission#SET_TIME permission.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context used for permission verification.
        time - Indicates a timestamp to set.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the time is set; returns a negative number otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setTime

        public static long setTime​(Context context,
                           Date date)
        Sets the system time.

        To use this method, obtain the SystemPermission#SET_TIME permission.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context used for permission verification.
        date - Indicates a Date object to set.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the time is set; returns a negative number otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getTimeZone

        public static String getTimeZone​()
        Obtains the system time zone.
        Returns:
        Returns the time zone, for example, "Asia/Shanghai".
        Since:
        1

      • setTimeZone

        public static long setTimeZone​(Context context,
                               String timezone)
        Sets the system time zone.

        To use this method, obtain the SystemPermission#SET_TIME_ZONE permission.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context used for permission verification.
        timezone - Indicates the time zone to set.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the time zone is set; returns a negative number otherwise.
